title: libuv Windows: compile errors with Windows 7 x64
body:
Hi,

The version of `libuv` I used is `v1.9.0`.

I built it with `Windows 7 x64 SP1` and `Visual Studio Express 2010`.

When I used `vcbuild.bat release` to build it, I got some errors:

```
E:\libuv-1.9.0>vcbuild.bat release
['-Dtarget_arch=ia32', '-Duv_library=static_library', '.\\uv.gyp', '-I', '.\\com
mon.gypi', '--depth=.', '-Dhost_arch=x64']
Project files generated.
  fs-event.c
src\win\fs-event.c(72): error C2275: 'size_t' : illegal use of this type as an
expression [E:\libuv-1.9.0\libuv.vcxproj]
          d:\microsoft visual studio 10.0\vc\include\codeanalysis\sourceannotat
  ions.h(29) : see declaration of 'size_t'
src\win\fs-event.c(72): error C2146: syntax error : missing ';' before identifi
er 'filenamelen' [E:\libuv-1.9.0\libuv.vcxproj]
src\win\fs-event.c(72): error C2065: 'filenamelen' : undeclared identifier [E:\
libuv-1.9.0\libuv.vcxproj]
src\win\fs-event.c(73): error C2275: 'size_t' : illegal use of this type as an
expression [E:\libuv-1.9.0\libuv.vcxproj]
          d:\microsoft visual studio 10.0\vc\include\codeanalysis\sourceannotat
  ions.h(29) : see declaration of 'size_t'
src\win\fs-event.c(73): error C2146: syntax error : missing ';' before identifi
er 'relpathlen' [E:\libuv-1.9.0\libuv.vcxproj]
src\win\fs-event.c(73): error C2065: 'relpathlen' : undeclared identifier [E:\l
ibuv-1.9.0\libuv.vcxproj]
src\win\fs-event.c(73): error C2065: 'filenamelen' : undeclared identifier [E:\
libuv-1.9.0\libuv.vcxproj]
src\win\fs-event.c(74): error C2065: 'relpathlen' : undeclared identifier [E:\l
ibuv-1.9.0\libuv.vcxproj]
src\win\fs-event.c(77): error C2065: 'relpathlen' : undeclared identifier [E:\l
ibuv-1.9.0\libuv.vcxproj]
src\win\fs-event.c(78): error C2065: 'relpathlen' : undeclared identifier [E:\l
ibuv-1.9.0\libuv.vcxproj]
```

In C89, we should declare/initialize all local variables at the beginning of a code block, so https://github.com/libuv/libuv/blob/v1.9.0/src/win/fs-event.c#L72 may cause such compile errors.

Is it okay to make a PR to fix it?

Thanks!
